register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the Debugss CLKC clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the Debugss CLKB clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the Debugss CLKA clock in the domain.
This field indicates the state of the L3_AON clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the Debugss sysclk clock in the domain.

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is active
Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the l3 AON clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register manages the DEBUGSS clocks. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Reserved
STM Trace clock divider control

bitenum.description: Divide by 4
Divide by 2
Divide by 1

bitfield.description: TPIU trace clock divider control

bitenum.description: Divide by 4
Divide by 2
Divide by 1

bitfield.description: TPIU Trace clock select

bitenum.description: Selects CLKC as TPIU trace clock
Selects CLKB as TPIU trace clock
Selects CLKA as TPIU trace clock
Selects DGBSYSCLK as TPIU trace clock

bitfield.description: STM trace clock select

bitenum.description: Selects CLKC as STM trace clock
Selects CLKB as STM trace clock
Selects CLKA as STM trace clock
Selects DGBSYSCLK as STM trace clock

bitfield.description: Module standby status.

bitenum.description: Module is in standby
Module is functional (not in standby)

bitfield.description: Module idle status.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including OCP

bitfield.description: Controls Optional Functional Clock CLKC

bitenum.description: Enable optional clock DEBUG_CLKC
Disable optional clock DEBUG_CLKC

bitfield.description: Controls Optional Functional Clock CLKB

bitenum.description: Enable optional clock DEBUG_CLKB
Disable optional clock DEBUG_CLKB

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control

bitenum.description: Enable optional clock DEBUG_CLKA
Disable optional clock DEBUG_CLKA

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is enabled
Optional functional clock is disabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
Module is disable by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the SW supervised clock domain state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the ADC0 FCLK clock in the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3S_ADC0 clock in the domain.

Corresponding clock is gated

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the always on clock domain.

bitenum.description: SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select between Triangular and SquareWave Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: Square Wave Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected (only available under proper licensing agreement)
Triangular Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected

bitfield.description: Control if only low frequency spread is required

bitenum.description: When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread only on the lower side of the programmed frequency
When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread on both sides of the programmed frequency

bitfield.description: Acknowledgement from the DPLL regarding start and stop of Spread Spectrum Clocking feature

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps
SSC has been turned off on PLL o/ps

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC enabled
SSC disabled

bitfield.description: Enable the REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL. [[br]]Please check the DPLL documentation to check when this mode can be enabled.

bitenum.description: REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: Set the DPLL in Low Power mode. [[br]]Check the DPLL documentation to see when this can be enabled.

bitenum.description: Low power mode of the DPLL is enabled
Low power mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: If enabled, the clock ramping feature is used applied during the lock process, as well as the relock process. [[br]]If disabled, the clock ramping feature is used only during the first lock.

This bit allows to enable or disable the automatic recalibration feature of the DPLL. [[br]]The DPLL will automatically start a recalibration process upon assertion of the DPLL's RECAL flag if this bit is set.

bitenum.description: DRIFTGUARD feature is enabled
DRIFTGUARD feature is disabled

bitfield.description: Selects the time in terms of DPLL REFCLKs spent at each stage of the clock ramping process

bitenum.description: 512 REFCLKs
128 REFCLKs
64 REFCLKs
32 REFCLKs
16 REFCLKs
8 REFCLKs
4 REFCLKs
2 REFCLKs

bitfield.description: The DPLL provides an output clock frequency ramping feature when switching from bypass clock to normal clock during lock and re-lock. [[br]]The frequency ramping will happen in a maximum of 4 steps in frequency before the DPLL's frequency lock indicator is asserted. [[br]]This register is used to enable/disable the DPLL ramping feature. [[br]]If enabled, it is also used to select the algorithm used for clock ramping

bitenum.description: CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout/1.5 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2/1.5 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/8 -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/8 -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => No ramping CLKOUTX2 => No ramping

bitfield.description: DPLL control. [[br]]Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect MN Bypass mode.

bitenum.description: Enables the DPLL in Lock mode
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.

register.description: This register allows monitoring the master clock activity. This register is read only and automatically updated. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DPLL MN_BYPASS status

bitenum.description: DPLL is in MN_Bypass
DPLL is not in MN_Bypass

bitfield.description: DPLL clock activity

bitenum.description: DPLL is LOCKED
DPLL is either in bypass mode or in stop mode.

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 2047). [[br]]This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. [[br]](equal to input M of DPLL[[br]] M=2 to [[br]]2047 => DPLL multiplies by M)
DPLL divider factor (0 to 127) (equal to input N of DPLL[[br]] actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT1 o/p of the HSDIVIDER.

bitfield.description: Power down for HSDIVIDER M4 divider and hence CLKOUT1 output

bitenum.description: M4 divider is powered down
M4 divider active

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT1 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT1

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT1_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M4, for internal clock generation. [[br]]Divide values from 1 to 31.

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT2 o/p of the HSDIVIDER.

bitfield.description: PPower down for HSDIVIDER M5 divider and hence CLKOUT2 output

bitenum.description: M5 divider is powered down
M5 divider is ACTIVE

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT2 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT2

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT2_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M5, for internal clock generation. [[br]]Divide values from 1 to 31.

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT3 o/p of the HSDIVIDER.

bitfield.description: Power down for HSDIVIDER M6 divider and hence CLKOUT3 output

bitenum.description: M6 divider is powered down
M6 divider is ACTIVE

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT3 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT3

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT3_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M6, for internal clock generation. [[br]]Divide values from 1 to 31.

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Fractional setting for DeltaMStep parameter

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select between Triangular and SquareWave Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: Square Wave Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected (only available under proper licensing agreement)
Triangular Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected

bitfield.description: Control if only low frequency spread is required

bitenum.description: When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread only on the lower side of the programmed frequency
When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread on both sides of the programmed frequency

bitfield.description: Acknowledgement from the DPLL regarding start and stop of Spread Spectrum Clocking feature

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps
SSC has been turned off on PLL o/ps

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC enabled
SSC disabled

bitfield.description: Enable the REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL. [[br]]Please check the DPLL documentation to check when this mode can be enabled.

bitenum.description: REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: Set the DPLL in Low Power mode. [[br]]Check the DPLL documentation to see when this can be enabled.

bitenum.description: Low power mode of the DPLL is enabled
Low power mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: If enabled, the clock ramping feature is used applied during the lock process, as well as the relock process. [[br]]If disabled, the clock ramping feature is used only during the first lock.

This bit allows to enable or disable the automatic recalibration feature of the DPLL. [[br]]The DPLL will automatically start a recalibration process upon assertion of the DPLL's RECAL flag if this bit is set.

bitenum.description: DRIFTGUARD feature is enabled
DRIFTGUARD feature is disabled

bitfield.description: Selects the time in terms of DPLL REFCLKs spent at each stage of the clock ramping process

bitenum.description: 512 REFCLKs
128 REFCLKs
64 REFCLKs
32 REFCLKs
16 REFCLKs
8 REFCLKs
4 REFCLKs
2 REFCLKs

bitfield.description: The DPLL provides an output clock frequency ramping feature when switching from bypass clock to normal clock during lock and re-lock. [[br]]The frequency ramping will happen in a maximum of 4 steps in frequency before the DPLL's frequency lock indicator is asserted. [[br]]This register is used to enable/disable the DPLL ramping feature. [[br]]If enabled, it is also used to select the algorithm used for clock ramping

bitenum.description: CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout/1.5 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2/1.5 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/8 -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/8 -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => No ramping CLKOUTX2 => No ramping

bitfield.description: DPLL control. [[br]]Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect MN Bypass mode.

bitenum.description: Enables the DPLL in Lock mode
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.

register.description: This register allows monitoring the master clock activity. This register is read only and automatically updated.[warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DPLL MN_BYPASS status

bitenum.description: DPLL is in MN_Bypass
DPLL is not in MN_Bypass

bitfield.description: DPLL clock activity

bitenum.description: DPLL is LOCKED
DPLL is either in bypass mode or in stop mode.

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: The value "NbCycles" set in this field determines the duration of the clock ramp step during which output frequency is Fdpll/(2*M2). [[br]]The duration is computed as 32 x NbCycles of WKUP-L4 clock cycles (SYSCLK/~26MHz). [[br]]Duration should be > 1.5us to allow enough time for DCC to lock. [[br]]This bit-field is only relevant when DCC_EN=1.
Selects CLKINP or CLKINPULOW as Bypass Clock

bitenum.description: Selects CLKINPULOW as Bypass Clock
Selects CLKINP Clock as BYPASS Clock

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Duty Cycle Correction. [[br]]Must be enabled only for frequency > 1GHz. [[br]]When enabled, the CLKOUTHIF output of the DPLL is used after duty cycle correction instead of CLKOUT. [[br]]M3 divider is hard-wired to 1 so the lock frequency Fdpll is directly provided to MPU.

bitenum.description: DCC enabled
DCC disabled

bitfield.description: DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 2047). [[br]]This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. [[br]](equal to input M of DPLL[[br]] M=2 to [[br]]2047 => DPLL multiplies by M).

bitenum.description: 1 : Reserved
0 : Reserved

bitfield.description: DPLL divider factor (0 to 127) (equal to input N of DPLL[[br]] actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the M2 divider of the DPLL.

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKOUT status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKOUT

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing DPLL_CLKOUT_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL M2 post-divider factor (1 to 31).

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Fractional setting for DeltaMStep parameter

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select between Triangular and SquareWave Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: Square Wave Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected (only available under proper licensing agreement)

When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread on both sides of the programmed frequency

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC enabled
SSC disabled

bitfield.description: Enable the REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL. [[br]]Please check the DPLL documentation to check when this mode can be enabled.

bitenum.description: REGM4XEN mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: Set the DPLL in Low Power mode. [[br]]Check the DPLL documentation to see when this can be enabled.

bitenum.description: Low power mode of the DPLL is enabled
Low power mode of the DPLL is disabled

bitfield.description: If enabled, the clock ramping feature is used applied during the lock process, as well as the relock process. [[br]]If disabled, the clock ramping feature is used only during the first lock.

This bit allows to enable or disable the automatic recalibration feature of the DPLL. [[br]]The DPLL will automatically start a recalibration process upon assertion of the DPLL's RECAL flag if this bit is set.

bitenum.description: DRIFTGUARD feature is enabled
DRIFTGUARD feature is disabled

bitfield.description: Selects the time in terms of DPLL REFCLKs spent at each stage of the clock ramping process

bitenum.description: 512 REFCLKs
128 REFCLKs
64 REFCLKs
32 REFCLKs
16 REFCLKs
8 REFCLKs
4 REFCLKs
2 REFCLKs

bitfield.description: The DPLL provides an output clock frequency ramping feature when switching from bypass clock to normal clock during lock and re-lock. [[br]]The frequency ramping will happen in a maximum of 4 steps in frequency before the DPLL's frequency lock indicator is asserted. [[br]]This register is used to enable/disable the DPLL ramping feature. [[br]]If enabled, it is also used to select the algorithm used for clock ramping

bitenum.description: CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout/1.5 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2/1.5 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => Bypass clk -> Fout/8 -> Fout/4 -> Fout/2 -> Fout CLKOUTX2 => Bypass clk -> Foutx2/8 -> Foutx2/4 -> Foutx2/2 -> Foutx2
CLKOUT => No ramping CLKOUTX2 => No ramping

bitfield.description: DPLL control. [[br]]Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect MN Bypass mode.

bitenum.description: Enables the DPLL in Lock mode
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.

register.description: This register allows monitoring the master clock activity. This register is read only and automatically updated. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DPLL MN_BYPASS status

bitenum.description: DPLL is in MN_Bypass
DPLL is not in MN_Bypass

bitfield.description: DPLL clock activity

bitenum.description: DPLL is LOCKED
DPLL is either in bypass mode or in stop mode.

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: Select CLKINP orr CLKINPULOW as bypass clock

bitenum.description: Selects CLKINPULOW as Bypass Clock
Selects CLKINP Clock as BYPASS Clock

bitfield.description: DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 2047). [[br]]This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. [[br]](equal to input M of DPLL[[br]] M=2 to [[br]]2047 => DPLL multiplies by M).

bitenum.description: 1 : Reserved
0 : Reserved

bitfield.description: DPLL divider factor (0 to 127) (equal to input N of DPLL[[br]] actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the M2 divider of the DPLL.

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKOUT status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKOUT

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing DPLL_CLKOUT_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL M2 post-divider factor (1 to 31).

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKOUT1 o/p of the DDR PLL HSDIVIDER.

bitfield.description: Power down for HSDIVIDER M4 divider and hence CLKOUT1 output

bitenum.description: M4 divider is powered down
M4 divider active

bitfield.description: HSDIVIDER CLKOUT1 status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of HSDIVIDER CLKOUT1

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing HSDIVIDER_CLKOUT1_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL post-divider factor, M4, for internal clock generation. [[br]]Divide values from 1 to 31.

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Fractional setting for DeltaMStep parameter

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select between Triangular and SquareWave Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: Square Wave Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected (only available under proper licensing agreement)
Triangular Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected

bitfield.description: Control if only low frequency spread is required

bitenum.description: When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread only on the lower side of the programmed frequency
When SSC is enabled, clock frequency is spread on both sides of the programmed frequency

bitfield.description: Acknowledgement from the DPLL regarding start and stop of Spread Spectrum Clocking feature

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps
SSC has been turned off on PLL o/ps

bitfield.description: Enable or disable Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: SSC enabled
SSC disabled

bitfield.description: DPLL control. [[br]]Upon Warm Reset, the PRCM DPLL control state machine updates this register to reflect DPLL Low Power Stop mode.

bitenum.description: Enables the DPLL in Lock mode
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.

register.description: This register allows monitoring the master clock activity. This register is read only and automatically updated. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: DPLL MN_BYPASS status

bitenum.description: DPLL is in MN_Bypass
DPLL is not in MN_Bypass

bitfield.description: DPLL clock activity

bitenum.description: DPLL is LOCKED
DPLL is either in bypass mode or in stop mode.

register.description: This register provides controls over the DPLL.

bitfield.description: Sigma-Delta divider select ([[br]]2-255). [[br]]This factor must be set by s/w to ensure optimum jitter performance. [[br]]DPLL_SD_DIV = CEILING ([DPLL_MULT/(DPLL_DIV+1)] * CLKINP / 250), where CLKINP is the input clock of the DPLL in MHz). [[br]]Must be set with M and N factors, and must not be changed once DPLL is locked.

DPLL multiplier factor (2 to 4095). [[br]]This register is automatically cleared to 0 when the DPLL_EN field in the *CLKMODE_DPLL* register is set to select MN Bypass mode. [[br]](equal to input M of DPLL[[br]] M=2 to [[br]]4095 => DPLL multiplies by M).

bitenum.description: 1 : Reserved
0 : Reserved

bitfield.description: DPLL divider factor (0 to 255) (equal to input N of DPLL[[br]] actual division factor is N+1).

register.description: This register provides controls over the M2 divider of the DPLL.

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKOUT status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKOUT

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

bitfield.description: Toggle on this status bit after changing DPLL_CLKOUT_DIV indicates that the change in divider value has taken effect
DPLL M2 post-divider factor (1 to 31).

register.description: This register provides DPLL fractional multiplier factor control and BandWidth Control for PER DPLL.

bitfield.description: RESERVED
RESERVED
RESERVED
RESERVED
RESERVED
DPLL fractional multiplier factor. [[br]]Setting to 0 keeps DPLL in integer mode. [[br]]This field should be used only for DEBUG purpose.

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Fractional setting for DeltaMStep parameter

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: This register provides controls over the CLKDCOLDO output of the DPLL.

bitfield.description: Software control for PWRDN on DCOLDO O/P

bitenum.description: DCOLDO O/P is PWRDN
DCOLDO O/P is ACTIVE

bitfield.description: DPLL CLKDCOLDO status

bitenum.description: The clock output is enabled
The clock output is gated

bitfield.description: Control gating of DPLL CLKDCOLDO

bitenum.description: Force this clock to stay enabled even if there is no request
Automatically gate this clock when there is no dependency for it

register.description: This register allows controlling the DPLL modes.

bitfield.description: Select between Triangular and SquareWave Spread Spectrum Clocking

bitenum.description: Square Wave Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected (only available under proper licensing agreement)
Triangular Spread Spectrum Clocking is selected

bitenum.description: SSC has been turned on on PLL o/ps
SSC has been turned off on PLL o/ps

register.description: This register provides DPLL fractional multiplier factor control, SELFREQDCO control and BandWidth Control for EXTDEV DPLL.

bitfield.description: RESERVED
RESERVED
RESERVED
RESERVED
RESERVED

Register for controlling the input 'freqseldco' for the DPLL_EXTDEV. [[br]]Legal values are '010'[if DCO clk is in the range [[br]]500-1000MHz] and '100'[if DCO clk is in the range [[br]]1000-2000MHz]

bitenum.description: This values needs to be selected in the DCO clk freq is in the range 1000-2000 MHz.
This values needs to be selected in the DCO clk freq is in the range 500-1000 MHz.

bitfield.description: DPLL fractional multiplier factor. [[br]]Setting to 0 keeps DPLL in integer mode.

register.description: Control the DeltaMStep parameter for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique DeltaMStep is split into fractional and integer part. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Fractional setting for DeltaMStep parameter

register.description: Control the Modulation Frequency (Fm) for Spread Spectrum Clocking technique by defining it as a ratio of DPLL_REFCLK/4 Fm = [DPLL_REFCLK/4]/MODFREQDIV MODFREQDIV = MODFREQDIV_MANTISSA * 2^MODFREQDIV_EXPONENT [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the Exponent component of MODFREQDIV factor
Set the Mantissa component of MODFREQDIV factor

register.description: Shadow register to program new DPLL configuration affecting EMIF and GPMC (L3 clock) functional frequency during DVFS. The PRCM h/w automatically applies the new configuration after EMIF/GPMC have been put in idle state.

bitfield.description: Shadow register for CM_DIV_M2_DPLL_DDR.DPLL_CLKOUT_DIV. [[br]]The main register is loaded by WKUP-M3 with the shadow register value after EMIF IDLE if the FREQ_UPDATE field is set to '1'. [[br]]Divide value from 1 to 31.
Shadow register for CM_CLKMODE_DPLL_DDR.DPLL_EN. [[br]]The main register is loaded by WKUP-M3 with the shadow register value after EMIF IDLE if the FREQ_UPDATE field is set to '1'.

bitenum.description: Enables the DPLL in Lock mode
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.

bitfield.description: Specify if DLL should be reset or not during the frequency change hardware sequence.

bitenum.description: DLL is reset automatically during the frequency change hardware sequence
DLL is not reset during the frequency change hardware sequence

bitfield.description: Shadow register for CM_DLL_CTRL.DLL_OVERRIDE.The main register is automatically loaded with the shadow register value after EMIF IDLE if the FREQ_UPDATE field is set to '1'.

bitenum.description: Lock output is overriden to '1' and code output is overriden with a value coming from control module.
Lock and code outputs are not overriden

bitfield.description: Reserved
Writing '1' indicates that a new configuration is available. [[br]]It is automatically cleared by h/w after the configuration has been applied.

register.description: Shadow register to program new DPLL configuration affecting GPMC (L3 clock) functional frequency during DVFS. The PRCM h/w automatically applies the new configuration after EMIF/GPMC have been put in idle state.

bitfield.description: Shadow register for CM_CLKMODE_DPLL_CORE.DPLL_EN.

bitenum.description: Enables the DPLL in Lock mode
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Fast Relock mode.
Put the DPLL in Idle Bypass Low Power mode.
Put the DPLL in MN Bypass mode. The DPLL_MULT register bits are reset to 0 automatically by putting the DPLL in this mode.

bitfield.description: Shadow register for CM_DIV_M4_DPLL_CORE.DIV. [[br]]The main register is loaded by WKUP-M3 with the shadow register value after GPMC IDLE if the CM_SHADOW_FREQ_CONFIG1.FREQ_UPDATE field is set to '1' and GPMC_FREQ_UPDATE is set to '1'. [[br]]Divide value from 1 to 31.
Reserved
Controls whether or not GPMC has to be put automatically into idle during the frequency change operation.

bitenum.description: GPMC is put automatically into idle during frequency change operation.
GPMC is not put automatically into idle during frequency change operation.
